alert.note: Alert for Chester (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 25 at 7:07PM EDT until July 26 at 1:03PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... East Branch Brandywine Creek Below Downingtown affecting Chester County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Branch Brandywine Creek Below Downingtown. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 6.0 feet, Open adjacent land next to the creek floods. At 8.0 feet, Dowlin Forge Road begins to flood. At 9.0 feet, High water on the Brandywine sends backwater up Beaver Creek. Beaver Creek floods inundating parks and the Downingtown Little League fields. At 11.0 feet, Jefferson Avenue in Downingtown floods. Business Route 30 and Pennsylvania Avenue also flood. At 12.0 feet, Residential basements flood along Jefferson Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 10.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:45 PM EDT Tuesday was 10.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 11.2 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.1 feet on 01/26/1978. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Stg Time Date East Branch Bran Downingtown 7.0 10.8 Tue 6 pm 3.1 MSG 11.2 9pm 7/25 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning by 715 AM EDT.
